knimeNode.name: Loop End
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node at the end of a loop

fullDescription.intro: Node at the end of a loop. It is used to mark the end of a workflow loop and collects the intermediate results by row-wise concatenation of the incoming tables. The start of the loop is defined by the loop start node, in which you can define how often the loop should be executed (either fixed or derived from data, e.g. the "group loop start"). All nodes in between are executed that many times.
fullDescription.option: Allows you to add a column containing the iteration number to the output table.

If set, the iteration number is added to each row ID from the incoming table, thus making the row IDs unique over all iterations. If unset, the incoming row keys are not altered. In this case you have to make sure that there are not duplicate row IDs in different iterations. Otherwise an error occurs.

ports.outPort: Collected results from the loop body
